communications.subject: PARP Request 23-0057; Bus Priority Violation Detection COBTR222155
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Saulnier:

This is the Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority's (WMATA) final decision in response to your March 6, 2023, Public Access to Records Policy (PARP) request regarding Solicitation No. 0000008611 for the Bus Priority Violation Detection System.  Specifically, you requested the following records:


  1.  "Evaluation scores/notes related to ALL proposers
  2.  Submitted responses of ALL proposers (with the exception of Verra Mobility)
  3.  Debrief documents related to ALL proposers"

Your request was processed pursuant to WMATA's PARP.[1]

Previous Partial Decision

On March 30, 2023, WMATA denied all portions of your request that pertain to companies other than the successful offeror pursuant to PARP Exemption 6.1.3 (exempt by statute - F.A.R. Section 24.202 - a proposal shall not be made available under the Freedom of Information Act unless it is incorporated into a contract) and PARP Exemption 6.1.4 (confidential commercial information).  WMATA also denied Part 1 of your request pursuant to PARP Exemption 6.1.5 (deliberative process privilege).

Decision

Please find attached the following records responsive to the remainder of your request (133 pages total):


  1.  COBTR222155 Hayden AI Successful Proposal (133 pages).

Pursuant to PARP Exemption 6.1.4 (confidential commercial information), we have redacted business proprietary information that our contractor customarily and actually treats as confidential.

Pursuant to PARP Exemption 6.1.5 (deliberative process privilege & self-evaluative privilege), we have redacted observations, evaluations, and determinations that were issued to help WMATA make a final decision.

Pursuant to PARP Exemption 6.1.6 (personal privacy), we have redacted personal information of individuals whose privacy interests outweigh the public interest in disclosure.

After a search reasonably calculated to find all relevant records, WMATA has found no additional records responsive to your request.

Processing Fees

WMATA spent more than 2 hours of staff time processing the records responsive to your request, which would normally result in processing fees which you would be responsible for.  However, the processing time was divided among the number of requesters seeking similar records, and as a result, the assessed processing time for this request is less than two hours.  Accordingly, pursuant to PARP § 8.5, the processing fees are waived.

Appeal Rights

If you wish to appeal WMATA's decision, in accordance with PARP § 9.1, you may file a written appeal of the action with the Executive Vice President, External Relations (or designee) at PARP_Appeal@wmata.com<mailto:PARP_Appeal@wmata.com>, within 30 business days of the date of this decision letter.  Further details about our appeals process can be found on our website.

Future correspondence should reference the request number noted in the subject line of this correspondence. If you have any questions, please contact me, if I am unavailable, you may contact Richard Noh at RDNoh@wmata.com<mailto:RDNoh@wmata.com> or 202-962-2569.

Sincerely,

Brian Yanos

[1] The PARP can be found on WMATA's website at https://www.wmata.com/about/records/public-records.cfm, under the section marked "Legal Affairs."

[cid:image001.jpg@01DA003F.2D5DC2B0]

Brian J. Yanos
Associate Counsel
Legal Department
300 7th Street, SW
Washington, DC 20024
P: 202-627-4542
E: BJYanos@wmata.com<mailto:BJYanos@wmata.com>

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Complaints of food poisoning from Chipotle
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All food poisoning complaints from any Chipotle in Reno, NV between January 2020-September 2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Evan Lake

communications.subject: Village of Fox Lake Secure Messaging Registration Confirmation
communications.communication:
Dear Carolyn,

Your registration with Village of Fox Lake Secure Messaging was completed successfully. Now that you've registered with Village of Fox Lake Secure Messaging, communicating securely is easy!

As you know, Village of Fox Lake Secure Messaging protects our confidential correspondences by using the same security technologies as internet banking when sending and receiving sensitive email messages. But you likely didn't know that this service allows you to do so much more than address security and compliance, or guarantee delivery of messages that prevent statements such as "I never received it".

Village of Fox Lake Secure Messaging includes a patented Delivery Slip - a powerful tool for users that provides many features for increased efficiencies and control over sensitive messages and attachments. It is found on the right side of  all secure message, both in this Secure Message Center and your desktop Microsoft Outlook program ('Enable with MS Office Outlook').

5 things you can do with the Delivery Slip

Here's just 5 things you can do with the Delivery Slip that you probably never thought possible with basic email:

1. Know what happens to your secure message once it's sent. Track and prove when a secure message and attachment is received, read, replied to, forwarded, deleted or printed.

2. Send jumbo files via email. Now you can simply attach that 100 MB file to a message without having to find an external service to share it.

3. Completely recall a secure message - and it works! Now you can instantly retract a secure message and attachment - even days or weeks after the recipient has read the message - resulting in the recipient's inability to access or read the recalled secure message.

4. Prevent a recipient from forwarding or replying to a secure message; or prevent a recipient from printing or saving a message or attachment.

5. Add extra security for ultra-sensitive content with 'For Your Eyes Only' by including an additional password required for the message or attachment to be opened by the recipient. Also prevents internal or external access by email delegates.

Learn more about the benefits of  Village of Fox Lake Secure Messaging unique features: http://www.appriver.com/

Thank you, and we're glad to have you as part of Village of Fox Lake Secure Messaging!

_________________

communications.subject: RE: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Responses to March 1, 2023 email from Ryan Kelly about getting pickpocketed at the meeting.
communications.communication:
Good morning,
We sent our final response to your request on October 4, 2023, which we received an undeliverable message that the file was too large so we downsized the file and resent on October 5, 2023. We have received no further notifications that it was undeliverable and marked your request as complete.  We are assuming based on receiving this follow up request that you did not receive our response. So we are resending our response through our secure messaging portal, which allows for larger files to be sent. We have sent you an invite link. Please follow the prompts to retrieve your request.

Please let me know if you have any issues or questions.

Thank you,
Ashley


Ashley Magnine

communications.subject: Wyoming Public Records Act Request: Campbell County Sheriff Book Reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wyoming Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any police report, incident report, complaint, or other report concerning the content of books or programs at the [library]. This includes, but is not limited to, any complaints filed by Hugh Bennett or Susan Bennett in September 2021. This request is limited to reports or complaints after January 1, 2021.

2. Any document, records, or materials referenced in any of the reports referenced in (1), above.

3. A copy of the October 27, 2021, letter from Michael Stulken to the Campbell County Sheriff's Office concerning library books.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: [Document Released to Requester] Campbell County, WY public records request #23-163
communications.communication:
Campbell County, WY ************************************************************************ Documents have been released for record request #23-163 along with the following message: Good Morning Adam,  This message will provide you access with documents available regarding your Public Records Request # 23-163 submitted on October 8, 2023. We are providing the following information:   For Item one (1) We included the one report which was filed with the Campbell County Sheriff's Office.    Regarding item two (2). Supporting evidence cited in that report were books belonging to the Campbell County Library and have since been returned to the library, there is no digitization of those documents and in compliance with Wyoming State Statute 16-4-202 (d)(iii) we are not to create a record where one does not already exist. However a list of the titles included in the complaint are in the letter from Attorney Michael Stulken.    For item number three (3) The letter from Weston County Attorney, Michael Stulken to Campbell County Sheriff, declining to prosecute has been included.    As your request is for "any police report", it is possible reports were filed with the City of Gillette Police Department as the Campbell County Library is within the limits of the City, as such Campbell County Government would not be the custodian of those records. As required by W.S. § 16-4-202(b) the custodian of records for the City of Gillette, as listed on the State Public Records Ombudsman’s website (https://governor.wyo.gov/contact/public-records-ombudsman) is  Cindy Staskiewicz 307-686-5211 clerk@gillettewy.gov Or, you can reach out to the City of Gillette Police Department Records at 307-682-5155 or visit their website for more information at https://www.gillettewy.gov/city-government/departments/police/records Please reach out with any question, Regards, Leslie Perkins Public Information Officer 307-687-6318 * 21-06990 Sex Offense.pdf * Weston County Letter Declining Prosecution.pdf Document links are valid for one month. After November 16, you will need to sign in to view the document(s). ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at Campbell County, WY.
Technical support: See our help page

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: 2020 Police Data Collection (Miami-Dade Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. the total number of use of force incidents, separated by type of force used in 2020 (for example, "27 taser incidents in 2020, 3 baton incidents in 2020, etc.)
2. the total number of civilian complaints alleging any form of law enforcement misconduct that were reported and the total number sustained in 2020.
3. the total number of civilian complaints alleging law enforcement use of excessive force that were reported and the total number sustained in 2020.
4. the total number of civilian complaints alleging biased policing or racial profiling that were reported and the total number sustained in 2020.
5. the total number of civilian complaints alleging criminal conduct that were reported and the total number sustained in 2020.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. the total number of use of force incidents, separated by type of force used in 2020 (for example, "27 taser incidents in 2020, 3 baton incidents in 2020, etc.)
2. the total number of civilian complaints alleging any form of law enforcement misconduct that were reported and the total number sustained in 2020.
3. the total number of civilian complaints alleging law enforcement use of excessive force that were reported and the total number sustained in 2020.
4. the total number of civilian complaints alleging biased policing or racial profiling that were reported and the total number sustained in 2020.
5. the total number of civilian complaints alleging criminal conduct that were reported and the total number sustained in 2020.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

Upload documents directly: https://https://www.muckrock.comhttps://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fmiami-dade-county-police-387%252F2020-police-data-collection-miami-dade-police-department-109579%252F%253Femail%253Dmiamidadecountyfl%252540mycusthelp.net&url_auth_token=AAAVQ2hCn74XSN1n984dHfvOqm4%3A1lKCQU%3ATDsuWtKWB1SfFzcPsejwImYkrzw 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant person(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request.  You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. NOTE: Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, Central Records Bureau has adjusted its normal operations and reduced staffing until further notice. As a result, you may experience a longer than usual delay in the processing of your Records Request. 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the We apologize for the inconvenience and appreciate your understanding. Records Requests will be fulfilled in the order in which they were received. Public Records Center.

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: ASERAP Rental Assistance Form
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

* blank copies of any forms that asylum seekers must submit in order to receive rental assistance under the ASERAP program.
* blank copies of any forms that landlords or lessors must submit in order to receive rental assistance under the ASERAP program.
* any records sufficient to show the eligibility requirements for applying to the ASERAP program on the part of the asylum seeker and landlord

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Forest Gregg

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Riverbend Park emails after April 4th 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

All documents (including emails, texts, and any other communications) concerning the scheduling of pedestrian and bicycle access to Riverbend Park in Cambridge sent on or after April 5 2023, including, but not limited to, documents and communications concerning whether or not to close Memorial Drive/Riverbend Park to vehicular traffic on Saturdays.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

George Schneeloch

communications.subject: Public Records Request

Thank you for patience,

Mike

Michael Tencellent
Paralegal
Department of Conservation and Recreation
State Transportation Building
10 Park Plaza, Suite 6620
Boston, MA 02114

title: Freedom of Information Act Request: Tobacco Farmworkers Complaints

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Freedom of Information Act Request: Tobacco Farmworkers Complaints
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to request all complaints related to health and safety submitted to the Department of Labor's Occupational Safety and Health Administration filed by or on behalf of tobacco farmworkers, between December 2021 and November 2022. 

I am a journalist with Civil Eats, and this information will be used for an article pertaining to the health of U.S. farmworkers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Grey Moran

Your request has been assigned to the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) with tracking number 2023-F-08899Y. title: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Personnel and disciplinary records, subject: fmr. Police Officer Mdtazwar Hasan

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Personnel and disciplinary records, subject: fmr. Police Officer Mdtazwar Hasan
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Personnel and the complete disciplinary record of former Police Officer Mdtazwar Hasan and all disciplinary records that identify P.O. Mdtazwar Hasan as a subject. For specificity and to rule out duplicates, Mdtazwar Hasan was arrested on July 23, 2022 in the confines of the 107 Precinct in the County of Queens, New York. 

Divisions that may hold responsive records include Internal Affairs, Employment Management, and Department Advocate's Office; however, any record used to evaluate performance toward the subject's continued employment or promotion should be considered responsive.

In accordance with the Freedom of Information Law as amended by Chapter 96 of the Laws of New York of 2020, records that may be released include "the complaints, allegations, and charges against an employee; the name of the employee complained of or charged; the transcript of any disciplinary trial or hearing, including any exhibits introduced at such trial or hearing; the disposition of any disciplinary proceeding; and the final written opinion or memorandum supporting the disposition and discipline imposed including the agency's complete factual findings and its analysis of the conduct and appropriate discipline of the covered employee."

Under precedent, Freedom of Information Law uses a "balancing test" method of weighing privacy interests favoring redaction/denial against the public interest in favor of disclosure. This matter is of clear public interest for the following reasons: P.O. Mdtazwar Hasan has been publicly accused of engaging in an off-duty act of domestic violence in the County of Queens: https://bronx.com/nypd-police-officer-mdtazwar-hasan-24-arrested-2/

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kim Smith

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: April 2023 (Pittsburgh Bureau of Police)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

In April of 2023, three unfounded calls reporting an active shooter on the University of Pittsburgh’s Oakland campus prompted a massive police response. News reports say University and city police responded to the campus at about 11:15 p.m on April 10th after police received three calls stating a shooter was in the Hillman Library on Forbes Avenue. In one call, the sound of gunshots was heard in the background, Pitt Police Chief Jim Loftus told reporters. 

I am looking for the audio of these calls as well as any after action reports, incident reports, investigative reports, call detail logs and body camera footage of officers responding to this incident.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Automated License Plate Reader Licensing
communications.communication:
Dear Custodian of Records:

This letter constitutes a request under the California Public Records Act ("CPRA") from the Electronic Frontier Foundation, submitted with the assistance of MuckRock News. 

- All purchase orders, invoices and statements of work associated with automated license plate readers or ALPR data (including the companies Flock Safety, Vigilant Solutions, Motorola Solutions, Axon and Lehr Auto) for the period Jan 1, 2022 through today's date;
- All operative contracts and agreements with the above stated companies regarding ALPR systems or ALPR data for the period Jan 1, 2022 through today's date. 


CPRA requires you to undertake reasonable efforts to locate responsive records and to work in good faith with requesters to respond to their request. See CYAC v. City of National City, 220 Cal.App.4th 1385, 1430 (2013). Thus under the CPRA you are obligated to conduct a reasonable search and cannot deny a request merely because it might generate a large volume of records. 

We ask that you please respond to this request within 10 days either by providing all the requested records or by providing a written response setting forth the legal authority on which you rely in withholding or redacting any document, as well as stating when documents will be made available. Should you choose to withhold or reject this request, we ask that you provide an explanation of why your agency is responding differently compared to the many others that have complied with our request. 

We also request that any records maintained in an electronic format be provided in that same format (such as a PDF, CSV or XLS file), to avoid copying costs.

However, should you be unable to do so, EFF will reimburse you for the direct costs of copying these records (if you elect to charge for copying) plus postage. If you anticipate that these costs will exceed $25.00, or that the time needed to copy the records will delay their release, please contact me so that I can arrange to inspect the documents or decide which documents I wish to have copied. Please also provide an invoice and a cost breakdown of the fee estimate. If the fees are less than $25.00, please copy and send the records and invoice as soon as possible, and we will promptly pay the required costs.

Thank you for your consideration of this request. If you have any questions or concerns, or if I can provide any clarification that will help identify responsive documents or focus this request, please do not hesitate to contact me at (415) 436-9333 x151 or dm@eff.org. You may also mail correspondence to the Electronic Frontier Foundation, 815 Eddy. St. San Francisco, CA, 94109.
                                               
Sincerely,
 
 
Dave Maass
Director of Investigations
Electronic Frontier Foundation

communications.subject: Maine Freedom of Access Act Request: Maine State Vacancies
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maine Freedom of Access Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of current vacancies for all departments within the State of Maine, Location of Vacant Positions, along with when the position became vacant/last time position was filled ( may be called: Vacant Position Legislative Count / FTE Count)

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by 1 M.R.S.A. § 408(6). The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Corey Bouchard

communications.subject: RE: Maine Freedom of Access Act Request: Maine State Vacancies
communications.communication:
Hello,
This email is in response to a request seeking information pursuant to the Maine Freedom of Access Act.

The Department of Administrative and Financial Services (DAFS ) acknowledges your request, while simultaneously reserving the right to withhold, in part or in full, documents that are protected from disclosure by rule or statute.  Once we complete our review of the requested material, DAFS will provide you with an estimate of the time necessary to complete the process of responding to your request.  We may also require the payment of costs as authorized by law.

DAFS will notify you, within a reasonable time, of a date and time for review and copying of the documents (or by transmitting copies to you) not protected from disclosure.  Should any of the requested documents be withheld, we will identify the reason for not disclosing them.

Maine Department of Administrative and Financial Services
https://www.maine.gov/dafs/

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Jamesville Communications
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All letters and memos and their attachments exchanged between the State Commission of Correction and Onondaga County officials between December 9, 2022 and the date at which this request is fulfilled related to the planned closure of the Jamesville Correctional Facility (also known as the Jamesville Penitentiary).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chris Gelardi

communications.communication:
RE: FOIL Records Request created on August 27, 2023, Reference # R000147-082723 
 
Dear Chris, 
 
The New York State Commission of Correction received a public records request from you on August 27, 2023. You requested the following: 
 "To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records: 

All letters and memos and their attachments exchanged between the State Commission of Correction and Onondaga County officials between December 9, 2022 and the date at which this request is fulfilled related to the planned closure of the Jamesville Correctional Facility (also known as the Jamesville Penitentiary). 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Chris Gelardi 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fcommission-of-correction-10479%252Fjamesville-communications-151229%252F%253Femail%253Dfoil%252540scoc.ny.gov&url_auth_token=AAAv0fxZnPWFe3bwz3XVVlGAEUw%3A1qaRsZ%3AoGSlaVYzdu-_zNUxwML2ipH_g37oQY_xjDsmfFCSIO8" 
 
In reference to your records request, I require additional time to respond. This is due to the unexpected large number of responsive records and based on the need to gather and determine whether any of the information requested is statutorily exempt from disclosure. 
Accordingly, I estimate that by 10/26/2023, I will mail you copies of the responsive records. 
Charges may apply for copies of responsive records. If there is a charge, I will provide an invoice that is due upon receipt. 
 
Thank you for your patience in awaiting this information. 
 
Sincerely, 
 
NO STAFF ASSIGNED 
FOIL Office

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Quarterly Asset Forfeiture Reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All quarterly asset forfeiture reports filed by Washington state law enforcement agencies from Q1 2013 until the date this request was received, as required by WA RCW 69.50.505.8(c). Please also redact the identities of the prior owners of forfeited property.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: [External Message Added] Washington State Treasurer public records request #23-18
communications.communication:
Washington State Treasurer ************************************************************************ A message was sent to you regarding record request #23-18: Dear Ms. Terse, The Office of the State Treasurer (OST) received your public records request on April 14, 2023, for the following: All quarterly asset forfeiture reports filed by Washington state law enforcement agencies from Q1 2013 until the date this request was received, as required by WA RCW 69.50.505.8(c). Please also redact the identities of the prior owners of forfeited property. Your request has been assigned Public Records Request Number 23-18. We are in the process of gathering, identifying, and reviewing responsive records. Please be advised that we have the records for calendar years 2015 through 2022 available in electronic format. The records for calendar years 2013 and 2014 currently exist only in paper form. There will be a fee for converting the 2013-2014 records to an electronic format. The total cost will be based on the number of records to be scanned. We estimate that the charge for those records will be $120, although the final charge will be based on the actual number of records that are scanned. Please confirm whether you want us to proceed with the production for the years 2013 and 2014. We will provide the total cost before we begin scanning and collect payment at that time. We estimate that there will be approximately 4,800 pages of responsive records for 2015-2022, and approximately 1,200 pages for 2013-2014. You requested that we redact the names of prior owners which adds to the processing time. Accordingly, we will provide the records in installments. We estimate the first installment will be available on or before May 21, 2023. We will continue to provide installments every 30 days with an estimated completion date of August 18, 2023. If you have any questions about this request, please contact me directly through this Public Records Request portal, or by calling (360) 902-8907. Sincerely, Jilene Siegel OST Public Records Officer ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at Washington State Treasurer.

Technical support: See our help page

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #23-18
communications.communication:

Thank you for letting me know. In that case, please exclude records not available in electronic format from this request.

Thanks,
Rose

communications.subject: [External Message Added] Washington State Treasurer public records request #23-18
communications.communication:
Washington State Treasurer ************************************************************************ A message was sent to you regarding record request #23-18: Dear Ms. Terse, In response to my prior communication stating that the 2013 and 2014 reports currently exist only in paper form, you replied that we should exclude records that aren’t available in electronic format. While reviewing and preparing records for the first installment, I learned that some, but not all, of the 2015 paper reports have been scanned. (Converting the records from paper to electronic format is currently a work-in-progress that began earlier this year. After some of the 2015 reports were scanned, it was noted that 2015 was beyond the retention period. The decision was made at that time to discontinue scanning the records for calendar year 2015 and earlier.) Based on your request to limit our response to records that exist in electronic format, we will provide the 2015 records that were previously scanned, but we won’t scan additional 2015 paper records. Alternatively, please let me know if you prefer that we exclude all 2015 reports, but it may impact how quickly we are able to provide our full response. Because the conversion is a work in progress, many of the files clearly identify the reporting period in the filename, so we could easily exclude those 2015 reports. Many other files currently include multiple reporting periods, so we would need to review each page in those files to remove the 2015 reports. Please feel free to call me if you’d like to discuss these options further. Sincerely, Jilene Siegel OST Public Records Officer (360) 902-8907 ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at Washington State Treasurer.

Technical support: See our help page

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: IPA mobility program agreements
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) All requests for certification as an eligible organization under the Intergovernmental Personnel Act mobility program submitted to your agency since Jan. 1, 2017. Organizations wishing to participate in the mobility program must first submit request for certification packets to the agency with which they seek to partner. Detailed descriptions of the IPA Mobility Program, its rules and regulations, and the documentation participating agencies must maintain can be found here: https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/hiring-information/intergovernment-personnel-act/#url=Provisions.

2) A list, roster, database, or comparable record documenting all of the organizations currently approved by your agency to participate in the IPA mobility program. If a list, roster, database, or similar record containing responsive information is not available, I ask that you provide your agency's approval letter for each organization.

 3) A list, roster, database, or comparable record documenting all of the IPA mobility program assignments approved by your agency since Jan. 1, 2020. If a list, roster, database, or similar record containing responsive information is not available, I ask that you provide assignment agreement documents for each assignment. Please note: I understand and accept that some information—namely, SSN, address, DOB—would have to be redacted from the assignment agreements. It is for this reason that I've requested the records in formats that are easy to filter or redact. 

I request expedited processing of this request under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E)(v)(II). I am a working journalist and I intend to use the requested records to "[engage] in disseminating information ... to inform the public concerning actual or alleged Federal Government activity."

I also ask that all fees be waived as I intend to use the requested records to publish articles in the public interest and not for any commercial purpose. In the event you choose to impose fees, I request a detailed breakdown of the fees, including the hourly wage of each employee involved and an explanation justifying the employee hours required to fulfill the request.

Should you choose to reject this request or redact portions of it, I ask that you provide a detailed explanation and citations to the statutory exemptions and associated case law underlying your decision to withhold each/any portions from public review.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Todd Feathers

title: Police 9-1-1 records for 37607 NE Eagle View Dr Yacolt, WA 98675

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police 9-1-1 records for 37607 NE Eagle View Dr Yacolt, WA 98675
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the list of 9-1-1 and/or non-emergency incident call logs between June 1, 2020, and the date of fulfillment, for 37607 NE Eagle View Dr Yacolt, WA 98675.

All incident reports from and relating to 37607 NE Eagle View Dr Yacolt, WA 98675 between June 1, 2020, and the date of fulfillment.

I request that you release records for this request on a rolling basis as they become available and in electronic form.

If your agency does not maintain these public records, please let me know who does and include the proper custodian's name and address.

If you choose to deny this request, please provide a written explanation for the denial including a reference to the specific statutory exemption(s) upon which you rely. Also, please provide all segregable portions of otherwise exempt material.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Albert Serna Jr.

You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below. 
 
Clark County, WA

title: Texas OAG - Documents related to cost complaints of Texas Public Information Act - Text Messages

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Texas OAG - Documents related to cost complaints of Texas Public Information Act - Text Messages
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

This request is to review cost complaints related to Open Requests for Text Messages received by the Texas OAG.

This request has the following requirements: 

• A copy of any cost complaint(s) as articulated in section 552.2615 of the Texas Government Code - Complaints related to cell phone text messages.  

• Date range: January 1, 2016 to June 01, 2023.

• Any internal document or email generated by the Texas Attorney Office in response to the above Complaint(s).

• This request includes, but not limited to:

o Any document or email sent to, or received from the Complainant.
o Any document or email sent to, or received from the Government  agency with whom the complaint was made against.
o Any internal document or email generated by the Texas Attorney General Open Records Division in response to the Complaint(s).

• This request excludes the following:
 o  Tracking Sheets that are subject to attorney-client privilege and as defined in OR2019-17141.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Stuart Martin

--- Please respond above this line --- 

July 28, 2023 

Mr. Stuart Martin 
MuckRock News 
147288-70449197@requests.muckrock.com 
VIA E-MAIL ONLY 

Re: Public Information Request No. R018507 

Dear Mr. Martin: 

This e-mail is in response to your public information request to the Office of the Attorney General (“OAG”), received by the OAG on July 20, 2023. 

The OAG has reviewed its files and has located the attached documents that are responsive to your request.  Although the Public Information Act allows a governmental body to charge for providing documents under certain circumstances, the attached documents are being provided to you at no charge. 

Please note the OAG has redacted personal e-mail addresses from the attached documents pursuant to section 552.137 of the Government Code and the previous determination issued by the Open Records Division.  See Open Records Decision No. 684 (2009) (governmental bodies may withhold certain information without necessity of requesting decision from Open Records Division). 
The OAG believes the remaining information responsive to your request is excepted from required public disclosure.  Pursuant to section 552.301 of the Government Code, the OAG has requested a ruling from the Open Records Division.  A copy of our written communication to the Open Records Division is attached. 
If you have any questions, please contact publicrecords@oag.texas.gov. 

Sincerely, 

Meredith Coffman 
Assistant Attorney General 
Assistant Public Information Coordinator 
Office of the Attorney General 

To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Public Records Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HQPW-2BfEJTKdQSBI7jNWEQNRT2U4GFZsYxg-2B-2FQP-2F5B62BR1r9b2oGq2FGGWVDad8qKHmvYdgwu4034A94Uak8y84-3DCpKW_mEw0lXiePcCKq3Xrf1yR-2FTFNTNC013ZL2Ar001pdWa-2F-2F9MlP03Ohsp1rIxIOWFy5V-2BoZKWBUDJzrcbaY45f2iB2Nbvi03V-2FZqJQK-2BXsE3rXAv3myk62hsR8MqxkdXjksiYWfbQdZ44YSC5nRBCtUm2SX4FGKUeELQ0GgngWLin25SYRPie8-2BslBC2vFXB2PQGdNmqunRLRHX6SfUi4C5D2wV3jL-2FtPp-2BLhCzbV-2FVOPx-2Fe0U42hDX2NqY4KEx6j7-2FYf7pTruEQVcANDqgHRw0yrC4ofReyWkwqv8X4Om-2FSToIMb9-2FBekYl245zWr-2BniAmLi8Nfr3rFoDGqlwUsqZ1GgqCymEvBYZSimR2N2Fle-2Betjqi9fboj6Oqc8nKhqkXe)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Asset Forfeiture Expenditures
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Itemized expenditure and/or distribution of funds from asset forfeiture accounts in years 2019-2022

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #23-2680
communications.communication:
Hello Tammy,

Would you please clarify whether this spreadsheet is for the account into which asset forfeiture funds are deposited? Additionally, my request was for an itemized list of expenditures from that account.

As an example, here is the header of a file I received from another department:
00    DRUG FORFEITURE FUND
Account Number    Adjusted Appropriation    Expenditures    Year-to-date Expenditures    Year-to-date Encumbrances    Balance    Prct Used

Please let me know if you need any further clarifications.

Thank you,
Rose

title: San Angelo Police - Arrest of Jack Miller by San Angelo Officers - Open Records Requests

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: San Angelo Police - Arrest of Jack Miller by San Angelo Officers - Open Records Requests
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) A copy of any and all Open Records Request(s) received by the San Angelo Police Department.
2) A copy of any and all Open Records Request(s) received by the City of San Angelo, TX.
3) Date range: Between October 1, 2020 to March 30, 2021.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Hope this clarifies the request, if not just let me know.

Stuart

title: SEATTLE CITY ATTORNEY – Request for a complete electronic copy (.PDF) of all public documents filed with the Clerk of the Court in case # 21-2-11739-9 SEA - IRWIN ET ANO VS CITY OF SEATTLE.

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: SEATTLE CITY ATTORNEY – Request for a complete electronic copy (.PDF) of all public documents filed with the Clerk of the Court in case # 21-2-11739-9 SEA - IRWIN ET ANO VS CITY OF SEATTLE.
communications.communication:
SEATTLE CITY ATTORNEY – Request for a complete electronic copy (.PDF) of all public documents filed with the Clerk of the Court in case # 21-2-11739-9 SEA - IRWIN ET ANO VS CITY OF SEATTLE.

December 21, 2022

Via email to:  thomas.kuffel@seattle.gov

To Whom It May Concern:

On July 9, 2021 the Columbian reported:

“SEATTLE (AP) — Two now-former public records officers who blew the whistle about Seattle Mayor Jenny Durkan’s missing text messages have each filed $5 million claims against the city, saying they faced retaliation and felt compelled to resign.
Records officer Stacy Irwin, with support from colleague Kimberly Ferreiro, reported to the Seattle Ethics and Elections Commission that the mayor’s office had broken the Public Records Act in responding to requests from journalists and others for Durkan’s communications. The requests focused on decisions Durkan and other city officials made amid racial justice protests and unrest in the city’s Capitol Hill neighborhood last year.

The claims allege Irwin and Ferreiro were required to “perform illegal acts” and “subjected to scorn, ridicule, abuse and hostility” in retaliation for trying to comply with the law, The Seattle Times reported.”

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records in the care custody or control of the SEATTLE CITY ATTORNEY or in the alternative the CITY OF SEATTLE:

1.	I request a complete electronic .pdf copy of all public documents filed with the King County Superior Clerk of the Court in case # 21-2-11739-9 SEA - IRWIN ET ANO VS CITY OF SEATTLE. The documents requested should be exact .pdf copies of the attached screenshot from the King County Superior Court Clerk’s office (attached).

Documents requested include all court filings of all participants both plaintiff and defendant.

PRODUCTION AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

The use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA or NEXTREQUEST) for communication and production of records in response to a public records request is optional for the requestor in the State of Washington. Respectfully we decline to use any 3rd party "portal" system, specifically GOVQA and NEXTREQUEST.

Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment, or via no password, no registration internet cloud-based download link.

Please do not direct or invite us to use, register for, or communicate with your agency via any 3rd party portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other commercial 3rd party records portal service.

RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.
"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. 
No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format. Unless the records exist IN PAPER FORM ONLY, DO NOT instead create new records by printing native stored electronic files, then scanning and re-printing these newly scanned prints only to reproduce them in again in electronic production.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

1. I request a complete electronic .pdf copy of all public documents filed with the King County Superior Clerk of the Court in case # 21-2-11739-9 SEA - IRWIN ET ANO VS CITY OF SEATTLE. The documents requested should be exact .pdf copies of the attached screenshot from the King County Superior Court Clerk’s office (attached).

Documents requested include all court filings of all participants both plaintiff and defendant.

PRODUCTION AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

The use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA or NEXTREQUEST) for communication and production of records in response to a public records request is optional for the requestor in the State of Washington. Respectfully we decline to use any 3rd party "portal" system, specifically GOVQA and NEXTREQUEST.

Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment, or via no password, no registration internet cloud-based download link.

Please do not direct or invite us to use, register for, or communicate with your agency via any 3rd party portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other commercial 3rd party records portal service.

RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.
"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter.
No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format. Unless the records exist IN PAPER FORM ONLY, DO NOT instead create new records by printing native stored electronic files, then scanning and re-printing these newly scanned prints only to reproduce them in again in electronic production.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Thank you for your email. I am responding on behalf of the King County Executive Branch only per King County Code 2.12.005 and 2.12.230(B). The records that you are seeking would be held by the King County Superior Court and not the King County Executive Branch. You can make a request by contacting them at the following:



Superior Court Records Requests:

https://www.kingcounty.gov/courts/superior-court/get-help/public-disclosure-requests.aspx

Your request also appears to be addressed to the Seattle City Attorney. I would recommend contacting the City of Seattle directly to request their records. I now consider your request to be closed.



Thank you,



Joel Wade | Public Records Act Analyst

Office of Risk Management Services
King County Department of Executive Services

Good morning. In response to your questions, which are below:

1. You are claiming the Seattle City Attorney's office does not possess ANY electronic .pdf copies of any public documents filed with the King County Superior Clerk of the Court in case # 21-2-11739-9 SEA - IRWIN ET ANO VS CITY OF SEATTLE. We are not the Seattle City Attorney’s Office. This is the King County Public Records Program. You are requesting Seattle City Attorney records which would be held by the City of Seattle, not King County. If the Seattle City Attorney’s Office filed records with the King County Superior Court, you would need to contact the Court for those records. That is why you were provided with the Court referral in our previous email.

Please contact the Seattle City Attorney using the link below:
https://www.seattle.gov/cityattorney

To confirm, yes your request with the King County Executive Branch is closed. Please contact the City of Seattle directly for Seattle City Attorney records, and contact the Superior Court directly to request any records they may have.
Regards,
The Public Records Program

On July 9, 2021 the Columbian reported:

“SEATTLE (AP) — Two now-former public records officers who blew the whistle about Seattle Mayor Jenny Durkan’s missing text messages have each filed $5 million claims against the city, saying they faced retaliation and felt compelled to resign.
Records officer Stacy Irwin, with support from colleague Kimberly Ferreiro, reported to the Seattle Ethics and Elections Commission that the mayor’s office had broken the Public Records Act in responding to requests from journalists and others for Durkan’s communications. The requests focused on decisions Durkan and other city officials made amid racial justice protests and unrest in the city’s Capitol Hill neighborhood last year.

The claims allege Irwin and Ferreiro were required to “perform illegal acts” and “subjected to scorn, ridicule, abuse and hostility” in retaliation for trying to comply with the law, The Seattle Times reported.”

RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.

No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

EXEMPTION LOGS

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

The use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA or NEXTREQUEST) for communication and production of records in response to a public records request is optional for the requestor in the State of Washington. Respectfully we decline to use any 3rd party "portal" system, specifically GOVQA and NEXTREQUEST.

Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment, or via no password, no registration internet cloud-based download link.

Please do not direct or invite us to use, register for, or communicate with your agency via any 3rd party portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other commercial 3rd party records portal service.

RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.
"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter.
No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format. Unless the records exist IN PAPER FORM ONLY, DO NOT instead create new records by printing native stored electronic files, then scanning and re-printing these newly scanned prints only to reproduce them in again in electronic production.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

---

Dear Dirka Durkan,
 
Records are now available in response to your request C115279-122122 regarding the following:
 
SEATTLE CITY ATTORNEY – Request for a complete electronic copy (.PDF) of all public documents filed with the Clerk of the Court in case # 21-2-11739-9 SEA - IRWIN ET ANO VS CITY OF SEATTLE.

December 21, 2022

Via email to: thomas.kuffel@seattle.gov

To Whom It May Concern:

On July 9, 2021 the Columbian reported:

“SEATTLE (AP) — Two now-former public records officers who blew the whistle about Seattle Mayor Jenny Durkan’s missing text messages have each filed $5 million claims against the city, saying they faced retaliation and felt compelled to resign.
Records officer Stacy Irwin, with support from colleague Kimberly Ferreiro, reported to the Seattle Ethics and Elections Commission that the mayor’s office had broken the Public Records Act in responding to requests from journalists and others for Durkan’s communications. The requests focused on decisions Durkan and other city officials made amid racial justice protests and unrest in the city’s Capitol Hill neighborhood last year.

The claims allege Irwin and Ferreiro were required to “perform illegal acts” and “subjected to scorn, ridicule, abuse and hostility” in retaliation for trying to comply with the law, The Seattle Times reported.”

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records in the care custody or control of the SEATTLE CITY ATTORNEY or in the alternative the CITY OF SEATTLE:

1. I request a complete electronic .pdf copy of all public documents filed with the King County Superior Clerk of the Court in case # 21-2-11739-9 SEA - IRWIN ET ANO VS CITY OF SEATTLE. The documents requested should be exact .pdf copies of the attached screenshot from the King County Superior Court Clerk’s office (attached).

Documents requested include all court filings of all participants both plaintiff and defendant.

PRODUCTION AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

The use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA or NEXTREQUEST) for communication and production of records in response to a public records request is optional for the requestor in the State of Washington. Respectfully we decline to use any 3rd party "portal" system, specifically GOVQA and NEXTREQUEST.

Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment, or via no password, no registration internet cloud-based download link.

Please do not direct or invite us to use, register for, or communicate with your agency via any 3rd party portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other commercial 3rd party records portal service.

RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.
"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter.
No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format. Unless the records exist IN PAPER FORM ONLY, DO NOT instead create new records by printing native stored electronic files, then scanning and re-printing these newly scanned prints only to reproduce them in again in electronic production.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Attachments:

https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/DirkaDurkan/115893/All_Filings_21-2-11739-9_SEA.pdf
Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fcity-attorney-2546%252Fseattle-city-attorney-request-for-a-complete-electronic-copy-pdf-of-all-public-documents-filed-with-the-clerk-of-the-court-in-case-21-2-11739-9-sea-irwin-et-ano-vs-city-of-seattle-138189%252F%253Femail%253Dlawpdr%252540seattle.gov&url_auth_token=AAAS6SsxI79b-95396WoxyK_Avc%3A1p8CdV%3AekDa4-ndvuUWTlzMY2sBTtapTPH77Yhj-aKBdpazick

Navigate to the Public Records Request Center.
Select 'My Records Request Center'.
Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login.
Select this request: C115279-122122.
Select the 'View Files' button.
You can download records individually or all at the same time by clicking 'Download All'.
Please save your records as you may only download them from the system three times.
If you do not download your records within 30 days of request closure, the link to your records will expire.
If you believe you have received privileged or confidential records in error, please notify the City of Seattle immediately, through the Public Records Request Center or by email. Privileged or confidential records provided or received in error should not be reviewed, used, disseminated, distributed, or copied, and should be destroyed immediately. Thank you in advance for your cooperation.
 
 
 
We have provided all records responsive to your request. Your request is now closed.
 
Sincerely,
 
City Attorney's Office

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #C115279-122122
communications.communication:
Hello,

Thank you for reaching out to us. In speaking with the public disclosure officer handling your case, we have not received payment. If you can provide us with the information on when and where you sent the check(s), that will help us track this down within the City.

Nevertheless, we understand that the department did provide you the installment twice:

  1.  Through the GovQA portal that you can access and download per the directions provided to you
  2.  While it is not our policy to upload documents to third party sites, the department provided you records via the link you provided.
If you are continuing to have difficulties with your website, please contact the public disclosure officer through the GovQA portal  and we can discuss alternative ways to send you the documents and the costs associated with them.

Thank you,

Citywide Public Records Act Program
City of Seattle

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #C115279-122122
communications.communication:
Dear Dirka Durkan,
​
This acknowledges receipt of your public disclosure request C150117-082923 received on August 29, 2023 regarding:
Request for a complete electronic copy (.PDF) of all public documents filed with the Clerk of the Court in case # 21-2-11739-9 SEA - IRWIN ET ANO VS CITY OF SEATTLE.
Pursuant to RCW 42.56.520, this is notification that the City of Seattle has received your public disclosure request. At this time, we anticipate that we will be able to provide the requested records or a first installment of records on or about October 27, 2023.
​
Sincerely,
​
Thomas Corley
Public Disclosure Officer
Seattle City Attorney's Office

communications.subject: City of Seattle Public Records Request Center - Invoice Ready :: C150117-082923
communications.communication:
Dear Dirka Durkan, 
 
Records in response to your public disclosure request C150117-082923 received on August 29, 2023 are now available. The cost for the records is as follows: 
 
Invoice Number: INV23-C150117-1 
Total: $1.25 
 
To pay online, please follow these steps: 
 Please note that you will need to disable any pop-up blockers to make a payment using the system. 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Find this request: C150117-082923. 
  * Select the 'View Invoices' button. 
 
  * Opens a pop-up window showing your invoice: INV23-C150117-1. 
  * Click on the invoice and then the 'Pay Now' button. 
  * Continue processing your payment. 
  * Select 'Done'. 
  * Once the payment process is done, you are returned to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * After your payment is successful you will receive an email from our payments center. 
Once your payment has been approved, we will send you an email with instructions on how to download your records. Note that City staff must manually upload records. Records will be available one to two business days after payment. 
 
Please let your public disclosure officer (PDO) know if you are unable to pay online; your PDO will work with you on alternative ways to make your payment. 
 
You have 30 days from today's date to pay for your records. If the City does not receive your payment within this time period, your request will be considered abandoned, and you will need to submit a new request. 
 Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your E-mail contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center E-mails to your Inbox. (mailto:seattle@mycusthelp.net) 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.
